details.title: Heatmap Input Widget
details.description: Provides input data for a historic heatmap

preference.name: ngsi_server
preference.label: NGSI Server
preference.description: NGSI Server where the lamp post info is located

preference.name: use_user_fiware_token
preference.label: Use the FIWARE credentials of the user
preference.description: Use the FIWARE credentials of the user logged into WireCloud. Take into account this option cannot be enabled if you want to use this widget in a public workspace as anonoymous users doesn't have a valid FIWARE auth token. As an alternative, you can make use of the "Use the FIWARE credentials of the workspace owner" preference.

preference.name: use_owner_credentials
preference.label: Use the FIWARE credentials of the workspace owner
preference.description: Use the FIWARE credentials of the owner of the workspace. This preference takes preference over "Use the FIWARE credentials of the user". This feature is available on WireCloud 0.7.0+ in a experimental basis, future versions of WireCloud can change the way to use it making this option not funcional and requiring you to upgrade this operator

preference.name: ngsi_tenant
preference.label: Tenant
preference.description: Tenant/service to use when connecting to the context broker. Must be a string of alphanumeric characters (lowercase) and the "_" symbol. Maximum length is 50 characters. If empty, the default tenant will be used

preference.name: ngsi_service_path
preference.label: Service path
preference.description: Scope/path to use when connecting to the context broker. Must be a string of alphanumeric characters (lowercase) and the "_" symbol separated by "/" slashes. Maximum length is 50 characters. If empty, the default service path will be used: /

preference.name: date_range_widget
preference.label: Date range widget path
preference.description: Path to the widget for selecting the date range for the slider

preference.name: entity_types
preference.label: NGSI entity types
preference.description: A comma separated list of entity types to use for filtering entities from the Orion Context broker. This field cannot be empty.

preference.name: entity_id_pattern
preference.label: Entity Id Filter
preference.description: Id parttern of the entities to monitorize on the Orion Context Broker server

preference.name: attributes
preference.label: Attributes to display
preference.description: Comma separated list of attributes to display
